heading: stocks sag at week's end
subheading: investors are worried about the prospect of higher interest rates. it's enough to send them diving for cover.
author: reuters
text: stocks fell on wall street friday, capping a jittery week in which investors worried about the possibility of rising interest rates and inflationary pressures. "a big yellow flag was raised this week," said scott bleier, chief investment strategist at prime charter ltd."that's why we're drifting in a narrow trading range. people are waiting for fresh economic numbers to see if a case can be made for inflationary concerns," bleier said.the dow jones industrial average fell 37.46 points or 0.3 percent to close unofficially at 10829.28, bringing the blue chip average's loss for the week to about 84 points. the nasdaq fell 21.59 points to 2520.64.advancing issues outpaced decliners by a roughly 5-4 margin on moderate volume of nearly 700 million shares.copyright
